# Introduction

Videos, images, applets, and code related to our research on N-Periodics in an Elliptic Billiard [@reznik19a]. Tabachnikov is the seminal work on this subject [@sergei91]. We make frequent use of Kimberling's Encyclopedia of Triangle Centers [@etc] and concepts in planar geometry from [@mw].

# Interactive Applet

Try our P5.js interactive [applet](https://editor.p5js.org/dreznik/full/i1Lin7lt7) where you can easily inspect loci and other objects connected with the $N=3$ family.

```{r,out.width="75%",echo=F}
knitr::include_graphics("pics/applet_02.png")
# <iframe src="https://editor.p5js.org/dreznik/embed/i1Lin7lt7" width="800" height="600" zoom="50%"></iframe>
```

# Videos

```{r,include=F,message=F,cache=F}
df_videos <- read_csv("Elliptic Billiards Video Table.csv") %>%
  mutate(Video1=text_spec("v1",link=Video1),
         Video2=if_else(is.na(Video2),NA_character_,text_spec("v2",link=Video2)),
         Video3=if_else(is.na(Video3),NA_character_,text_spec("v3",link=Video3))) %>%
  mutate(urls=pmap_chr(list(Video1,Video2,Video3),
                       ~str_c(na.omit(c(..1,..2,..3)),
                              collapse=","))) %>%
  select(-starts_with("Video")) # %>%
  #unite(urls,Video1,Video2,Video3,sep=",",remove=T,na.rm=T)
```


```{r,echo=F,cache=F}
kable(df_videos,format = "html", escape = F) %>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed","responsive"),
                full_width = F,fixed_thead = T)
```



To simulate multiple ray bounces within an Elliptic Billiard, try our Mathematica [CDF](cdf/ray_bounces.cdf). It requires installation of the [Wolfram Player](https://www.wolfram.com/player/).
